quizlist.question: It is a value underlying the behavior as a Filipino where it stimulates generosity and working together, but it is often abused is called _________.?

There are three learning scope for instructional objectives. Which objective is NOT part of these learning scope?
Basically onboard training programs must be conducted___________.?
quizlist.option1: while the ship is at sea on a particular voyage

quizlist.question: What do you call a person/s ashore having a direct access to the highest level of management?
Which of the following would fit MOST on motivation?
quizlist.option1: Factor that cause, channel and sustain people's behavior
quizlist.option3: Efforts at keeping employees 'cheered up' at all times

quizlist.question: You are preparing to contain an oil spill. You must first receive approval from the Federal On-Scene Coordinator (OSC) prior to __________.?
What is the study of human capabilities in relationship to work?

Management of career is ultimately the responsibility of the__________.?

When required, the steering gear, whistle, and the means of communication between the pilothouse and the engine room on a passenger vessel shall be tested by an officer of the vessel within a period of not more than how many hours prior to departure?

What is the disadvantage of a matrix organization?
quizlist.option1: Members require some expertise in interpersonal relations

quizlist.question: Welding and burning are among the factors which give the highest risk of fire on board ships. Precaution has to be taken to avoid this risk. Which of the following safety rules may be regarded as the most important?
quizlist.option1: The welder shall have been instructed in the use of the ship's welding plant.
quizlist.option3: Only use electrodes from a well-known manufacturer.

quizlist.question: Personnel who have not been assigned to be part of the emergency squad, or allotted other duties and are not on watch at the time of the emergency will be assigned to the__________ .?

What is a factor that contribute to the occurrence of mistakes due to relationships among individuals.?

What is the type of human factor that contribute to operators committing error because of their work environment?

The question of human relations considers ___________.?
Behavior of a leader that deals with long range plan, broad relationship and ideas is called________.?
Type of human error when an operator is distracted or preoccupied with another task and allows a mistake to occur is termed as __________.?
Which should be done with the ashes from your vessels incinerator which has burned packages containing plastic?
Which of the following steps is not a part of the rational problem solving process?
quizlist.option1: Identify the symptoms of the problem

quizlist.question: There are three conflict methods most frequently used in managing conflicts; supervision, integrative problem solving and_________.?
What is the first step in planning?
quizlist.option1: Select goals for the ships organization
quizlist.option2: Set up guidelines for the ships organization

quizlist.question: Human performance breakdowns resulting to accident are more likely a result of__________.?

quizlist.option1: the entire steering gear be tested within 12 hours prior to departure
quizlist.option2: a lifeboat drill be held within 12 hours prior to departure
quizlist.option3: fire pumps be tested by starting within 12 hours prior to departure

quizlist.question: Which of the following is NOT a key to human relation?
quizlist.option1: Be strict and always expect good result.

quizlist.question: Managerial performance is based upon accomplishment of _____________.?

The routes, zones or areas of operations of domestic ship operators are prescribed by which government agency?
quizlist.option2: Office of the President of the Philippines

quizlist.question: As an officer of an engineeting watch. What would the best thing to do, if the Chief Engineer does not or cannot take the leadership ?
quizlist.option1: Take action to start the process to solve the situation, but do it diplomatically.
quizlist.option2: Take control, delegate some of the tasks to the Master
quizlist.option3: Take action to solve the problem in anyways

quizlist.question: When a Chief Engineer takes the leadership in approaching a problem, Will his first action be a decision that directly solve the problem?
quizlist.option1: Yes, take full control. Do not delegate to other officers, to avoid mistake.
quizlist.option2: Yes, with his experience, it is most likely that he has the best solution.
quizlist.option3: Not necessary, he shall use all available resources. He should resist the temptation to step in and do it all by himself

quizlist.option1: Take action to start the process to solve the situation, but do it diplomatically.

quizlist.question: The ability to get things done right is__________.?

quizlist.option1: To create sub-agencies for the safe transport of goods and passengers

quizlist.question: When oil is accidentally discharged into the water, what should you do after reporting the discharge?
quizlist.option1: Contain the oil and remove as much of it as possible from the water.
quizlist.option2: Throw chemical agents on the water to disperse the oil.
quizlist.option3: Throw sand on the water to sink the oil.

quizlist.option1: Chief Engineer, or engineer in charge if no chief engineer is required

quizlist.option1: not attack the fire from opposite sides
quizlist.option2: they must attack the fire from opposite sides
quizlist.option3: they must attack the fire from one side

quizlist.question: In order to maintain safe working conditions on board the vessel, every crewmember should do the following, except___________.?
quizlist.option1: be attentive to all what is happening in the surroundings
quizlist.option2: familiarize himself with the emergency plan
quizlist.option3: always keep in mind the safety of yourself
